metadata.title: CVE-2020-15702 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
TOCTOU Race Condition vulnerability in apport allows a local attacker toescalate privileges and execute arbitrary code. An attacker may exit thecrashed process and exploit PID recycling to spawn a root process with thesame PID as the crashed process, which can then be used to escalateprivileges. Fixed in 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.24, 2.20.9 versions prior to2.20.9-0ubuntu7.16 and 2.20.11 versions prior to 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.6. WasZDI-CAN-11234.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15702` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm5
apport-gtk - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm5
apport-kde - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm5
apport-noui - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm5
apport-retrace - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm5
apport-valgrind - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm5
dh-apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm5
python-apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm5
python-problem-report - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm5
python3-apport - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm5
python3-problem-report - 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apport package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm5').
